title.narrative: PARTICIPATORY SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY-BASED STRUCTURES MOBILIZATION

description.narrative: By 2020, participatory structures inside and outside schools are equipped to mobilise parents on the importance of enrolling and keeping their children, especially girls, in school in the targeted areas, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-age children, particularly girls and those in vulnerable regions, have access to quality basic education, including in emergency situations.

related-activity.ref: 0690/A0/05/885 ACCESS TO QUALITY BASIC EDUCATION FOR VULNERABLE CHILDREN

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, participatory structures inside and outside schools are equipped to mobilise parents on the importance of enrolling andkeeping their children, especially girls, in school in the targeted areas

description.narrative: To improve the participation of parents in the management and functioning of schools, 189 participatory school management structures have benefited from capacity building in social dialogue with their communities on issues related to school management, risk and disaster mitigation, peace education, enrollment and retention of girls and children with disabilities. In zones of emergencies 27,738 out-of-school crisis-affected children and adolescents, 55% of whom are girls, could access formal and non-formal education services. Through the direct support to government and communities to run schools during the COVID 19 pandemic, all operational schools continued offering services, and the school closure was prevented. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:03/02/2022
